intro: Laphamia cernua, commonly known as the drooping lophanthus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Laphamia cernua thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in arid ecosystem botany.
